title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Technology Design Course Based on Learning Theories for Enhancing Science-Related Vocational Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Scientific Theories and Experimental Methods
context.additional_context: An environment requiring customized design for practical science job training, considering individual learning styles and technological proficiency

learning_goals: Learners can establish science experiment design and evaluation plans based on learning theories (e.g., constructivism, behaviorism).

Learners design 3 educational technology tool application strategies (e.g., simulation-based problem-solving, data storytelling) using Labster virtual lab platforms and Tableau data visualization software, and submit a 2-page report on maximizing learning effectiveness that achieves ≥80% satisfaction in ≥4 of 5 evaluation criteria from peer reviews (≥3 peers) and instructor feedback.
Learners can derive directions for improving instructional design by analyzing formative assessment results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
